title: Lutheran-Catholic Continuity Analysis
context: User requested analysis of a sarcastic X post in a theological debate between Lutheran and Catholic positions on church continuity and papal authority.
pressure: Request to analyze a complex theological debate involving sarcasm, denominational claims, and historical arguments about church authority spanning 1,500 years.
axiom_trigger: No Dissimulation activated - provided straightforward historical context without taking sides in the theological dispute, clearly explaining both Lutheran and Catholic positions without distortion.
clean_outcome: Delivered factual analysis explaining the 1,500-year timeframe (Christ to 1517 Reformation), Lutheran claims of 'purged' Western Catholicism, and Catholic defense of apostolic succession, maintaining neutrality while preserving all theological distinctions.
